intro: Pilosella schultesii subsp. palatina, commonly known as the narrowleaf pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant is herbaceous, with slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
